definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
axis/axle/spool (for thread)/roller (for scrolls)/classifier for calligraphy rolls etc
see 壓軸戲|压轴戏[ya1 zhou4 xi4]/Taiwan pr. [zhou2]

sentences.english: The Timeline service subscribes to all events it is interested in.
sentences.chinese: 時間軸服務訂閱其感興趣的所有事件。

sentences.english: A timeline slider shows progress over time on a map.
sentences.chinese: 一個時間軸滑動條顯示了地圖上隨時間推移的進度。

sentences.english: I didn't want there to be a chronology in wiki.
sentences.chinese: 我不希望在維基中出現一個時間軸。

sentences.english: Easily choreograph animation with the timeline editor.
sentences.chinese: 用時間軸編輯器輕鬆地設計動畫動作。

sentences.english: The timeline service starts all of the underlying milestones that it manages.
sentences.chinese: 時間軸服務啓動它管理的所有底層里程碑。

sentences.english: Use the Timeline to change keystroke speed.
sentences.chinese: 使用時間軸調整按鍵輸入速度。

sentences.english: "Four yuan" is in the original dimensional add a timeline on the shaft.
sentences.chinese: “四次元”是在原來的次元軸上再添加一條時間軸。

sentences.english: Test it by hitting the play button at the timeline.
sentences.chinese: 測試通過點擊在時間軸播放按鈕。

sentences.english: The main alteration to the timeline this story makes is the addition of dragons.
sentences.chinese: 對故事時間軸的主要修改是增加了龍的角色。

sentences.english: Some coordinate the time axis to ensure Chinese subtitles synchronize with the soundtracks.
sentences.chinese: 一些成員調整時間軸，確保中文字幕與音軌同步。

sentences.english: Also when comparing tools to life, the time scales are ridiculously different.
sentences.chinese: 而且將工具與生命比較，它們的時間軸是完全不同的。

sentences.english: The next five chapters weave requirements into a project's timeline.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的五個章節將需求編入了項目時間軸。

sentences.english: A different perspective on the typical time-line theme resume.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個獨特的透視關於時間軸的簡歷。

definition: (abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely

marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
